title_sort: george d. cole to walt whitman, 13 november [1875]
title: George D. Cole to Walt Whitman, 13 November [1875]
text: New LondonctNov 13thDear Freand[Friend]WaltI take the liberty to write you a few lines hoping to find you well as I am at present I hope that you will excuse me fore[for] not writing to you before but you know how it is your self but I write you these few lines to let you know were[where] I am Walt you know wat[what] good times Petter and your selfe[self] and me had together Walt how is Harry my Boy I hope that he is well I have wrote to him severl[several] time and have not Receved[Received] no answer as yet but you must tell him that you have herd[heard] from me and give my love to him and take a good share fore[for] your self give my love to all the Boys on the Rail Road as fore[for] mr sailor tell him fore[for] me to go to the and so forth Walt I want you to write to me as soon as you get this you must excuse my writing fore[for] I am in a hurry tell Harry Parmenter to write to me so good byFrom your Freand[Friend]George D ColeWalt direct your letters to me George D Cole Tottenville Staten Island in care of Capt JW Sprague how is old car nonumber 29 my old car I have just come from Provedence[Providence]. we had to put in to new london fore[for] a Harbor fore[for] it is a low Blowing a gail[gale] of wind I am a sailor now and have been fore[for] a year she is a nice schooner you Bet George D. Cole to Walt Whitman, 13 November [1875]
